Jul 21
Contraptions

Bootstrapping is an interesting metaphor since it originated in an impossibility joke (Baron Munchsusen pulling himself out of a swamp by his own hair iirc). In practice, anything called bootstrapping relies on an absolute external force, like a human finger pushing a computer power button or a separate clock circuit triggering a relay.

The better mental model is Archimedes’ claim that given a place to stand he could move the earth. Though a pop science thing I once read calculated that for the effort force to be exertable by a human, the human would need to move faster than light. I’m actually not quite sure how this leverage configuration would work. Where’s the fulcrum? On the moon?

Anyhow, strikes me that many behavioral ideas have a hidden bootstrapping metaphor with no indication of how the implied impossibility is circumvented. Like economic growth, personal change etc.
